I wish all Airbnb stays were as great as this one! We stopped on our way through with several of our children and 5 grandchildren ages 0-5.
Parking was fine for 3 vehicles, with one in the garage.
We all enjoyed the Shel Silverstein books from the library, and the children loved the playroom toys. Plenty of room for 11 people.
The kitchen was clean and well stocked. There were lots of clean towels - we only used a fraction of the supply.
The decor was tasteful and comfortable - not as bare bones as you see sometimes. The house is old but feels well maintained.
I wholeheartedly recommend!

review_text: Our stay at the Farmhouse was so wonderful! This house is huge and stocked with pretty much everything you need. The 3 (!) bathrooms were spotless. The bedrooms were spacious and comfortable. I also couldn't believe how quiet the neighborhood was. Never once was I woken by traffic or people during our weekend stay. I slept so soundly. Jennifer was also very responsive through text. We really enjoyed our stay. My only complaint (and that of the other adult guests staying with us agreed) that the main floor of the house was very grimy. It was sticky and all of our socks had black stains on them from it. Not necessarily something I want to let my one year old walk/crawl around on. If there had been a steam mop at the place I would have cleaned it myself. Other than that there was nothing else wrong with our stay. We may very likely return again in the future!

Stayed with kids
review_text:
What a find! Things we loved: Walkable to the cute downtown (go see Expressions coffee shop. Coffee-snob worthy Italian beans per my Chicago/17year old/barista kid, beautiful breakfasts!)
This was perhaps the best-appointed airBNB we've ever visited. And it was immaculately clean. I think it's actually better in real life than the photos.
Some things that were life-savers: emergency monthly female supplies (13 year old was so thankful!), and snacks to hold over the 5 year old nephew from a meltdown. This is a well-laid out floor plan. Lots of getaway spaces, fun and quirky play room for the little kids, loved having box fans in each room. Seriously- every detail was attended to. Covered back porch was a beautiful spot for morning tea.
2 block walk to downtown, antique shop, a cute park with a gazebo was a nice meditation spot. It's a pretty picturesque midwestern small downtown. We'll for sure be back!

We had everything we needed. It is in waking distance of the historic library. And the town center. And close to stores. There is a full size bathroom with walk in shower down stairs. Which was so Helpful for my mother in law. She had trouble getting upstairs. The couch pulled out into a sleeper sofa. My mother in law finally decided to go with us. After I already booked the house. But It was easy to contact Jenniffer and get her added to her number of guests. The only issues we really had was my husband and mother could not get back in from the front porch after setting out and drinking coffee. The entry code did not work for that door. My husband had to walk around to get back in.

review_text: The "farmhouse on Wall" was a perfect location for our friends' board game weekend. We chose it for its central location from our homes in Chicago, Michigan, and Columbus. The house is very charming with a great kitchen, multiple rooms for hanging out (we especially loved the back room in the morning for its natural sunlight), and four large bedrooms with very comfortable beds. We had a nice afternoon walk to downtown Van Wert. There was a cool historic library, a few interesting antique shops, and we found a classic diner for lunch. I definitely recommend the house for any group looking for a relaxing getaway in a well-stocked & comfortable house in this area of Ohio.

Another issue we had is this property as you walk in is so perfumey you feel like youâ€™re at a bath and body works. review_text:
When our pipes burst on Christmas Eve we thought we were going to have a ruined holiday. No way to warm up, no way to cook or wash our clothes. Suddenly it felt like we were in the dark ages.
Thankfully, this beautiful and well appointed home was available, and was able to save the day for us! This home has a wonderfully stocked kitchen, an amazing washer and dryer and plenty of comfortable beds for your loved ones. Wifi is fast and reliable, the TV is easy to use and the heat works! We stayed in this home during one of the coldest times this year and were nothing but comfortable.
I am deeply appreciative for this home and this host. Thank you for making our Christmas enjoyable and not miserable experience.

The space was small but well laid out with everything we needed as well as a few activities for the children. All of the beds are upstairs and the bathroom is downstairs. The kitchen was well stocked for us to do our own cooking. We loved the peaceful country setting that made us feel more at home. The backyard was great for the children to play with the playsets and green space. It would have been fun to swim/kayak/play in the sand if it were summer. The trampoline was not assembled as pictured but maybe that is a seasonal thing as we arrived in November.
The place was clean, tastefully decorated and well thought out. Marci was a great communicator and a wonderful hostess. Would recommend!

review_text: Family with 3 kids from Germany, came to the area for a weekend to visit friends. Maci's place was perfectly located for our purposes, right between Bluffton (Walmart at approx. 8 minutes) and Ossian (don't miss Heyerley's bakery for the best donuts). We had a great stay for 3 nights. Our girls had a lot of fun on the property, with the family cat, the swimming pond and the swings. oh and the lightning bugs swarming the fields at dusk are another highlight. Marci is a real awesome host, very caring and accommodating, even helped us out greatly by taking care of our laundry, which was perfect for a fresh takeoff into our further vacation. Also enjoyed the forest neighboring the property, which belongs to the nearby High School is open to public use and features well maintained cross trails. We'll definitely recommend this nice place and come back if we get the chance some day.

review_text:
This two story apartment was designed and is maintained with love. Spotless and cozy, the comfortable furniture and warm decor made me wonder if the space was originally meant for the host's grown children or parents. In any case, it was perfect for our family's visit to relatives over Christmas.
Marci was an extremely warm and gracious host, pro-actively messaging us several times during our week-long stay to check in. She volunteered to provide a pack-n-play without my asking and also (twice!) to wash a load of laundry for us during our week-long stay.
One small inconvenience to note - there is no bathroom on the second floor, where the bedroom and bed nook are located. However, there is a nice light dimmer switch for the stairs, so you can safely descend at night without being blinded.

It was warm during our stay and the A/C worked well. We had all five of our group on the internet at times and found it plenty fast enough. We didn't really use the kitchen much, but it had what we needed. About the only negative is that the kitchen is carpeted and the carpet is damaged and worn out. Jack told me he plans to replace flooring when the season slows down. We did manage to fit a pickup truck towing an 8 ft U-Haul trailer and a compact SUV all in the driveway in case that applies to anyone else. We would return here should the need arise again.

The fridge is full size and the kitchen is well stocked with equipment i.e. plates, bowls, silverware, coffee cups, pots, pans, measuring cup, mixing bowls and baking dishes, including a glass bread loaf pan as well as a glass 8â€x 8â€ & glass 13â€ x 9â€ pan. The oven is a smaller width, but has full-size depth and worked great baking brownies in the 13x9 pan.
It was cold when we stayed, but the heat worked great.
My family and I would highly recommend a stay here!

There have been some recent updates to the place including a new heating and cooling system, and modern lighting on the ceiling fans. The location is perfect! It is close by to gas stations, restaurants, and downtown. Everywhere we needed to be was within 10 minutes.
Since it is on a busy street, there is some noise. If youâ€™re a light sleeper I would recommend bringing a fan or something along for some white noise. The water was barely warm. I could hardly withstand the shower because of it. I have reached out to the host with the recommendation of checking out the water heater. Otherwise we had no issues with our stay!

It's nice and bright inside once you throw open the curtains on the huge windows and the AC worked great! It's quick and easy to change to dark and cool if you're ready to relax for a bit. All of these things made me feel just like I was at home. Oh, and the bed in the master bedroom is to die for comfy!! Can't wait to visit my hometown again now, thanks Adam!!

Group trip
review_text: We travel full time, coast to coast, as touring musicians. Jessica's home in Decatur was one of our top stays. Jessica has created a wonderful respite that was much appreciated by our family (5 adults) while on-the-road between performances. Our time was necessarily brief but this would be a lovely location by those seeking accommodations for longer periods of time. We were able to cook our supper and although the dining area was beautiful and spacious we took our meal outside to the picnic table to enjoy the fresh air and song birds. We took a walk down the country road just as it was getting dark and recharged our spirits with the fireflies twinkling over the prairie grasses. A big storm blew through but we felt safe and comfortable inside and Jessica even messaged us to make sure we were ok and had power - we were!

review_text: Where do I begin! This place is like HOME. There were things this home had that I didn't even think about. I traveled with my elderly parents, my brother and my daughter and it was comfortable for us all. After coming from a funeral it was comfortable for us to relax and enjoy ourselves. It was so peaceful and warm during these cold days. There are plenty of blankets to feel nice and cozy and watch the big TV on the couch. I cooked full meals in the well equipped kitchen. My favorite part was the Sega Genesis game console, i felt like a kid again. Me and my 7 year old had some good times playing it our first night. There is literally nothing this home lacked. There were snacks waiting for us when we arrived. Jessica was great with communicating and prompt. This was my parents first experience at an air bnb and they were impressed. I've stayed at several in many different states and i would have to say this is my favorite. Thank you so much Jessica!

I also had trouble with the TV/Cable. The system was not synced properly and I had to spend about 30-45 minutes with the carrier to get them to work. Joy is an excellent host as she came out to help me in the pouring rain when i accidentally locked myself out DUH! but Joy was so nice and came right away! (Note to self is to not lock the front storm door to the porch and leave out the back door locking that too because you wont be able to get to the front door keypad if you do!) lol smh. But she couldn't have been any nicer about it. We really appreciated that. And apparently a spare key to back door was right there on the fridge for our use also but we had not seen it. I guess we were just so discombobulated from a long trip. But anyways I highly recommend this place and Host Joy for a stay and hope that it is available for a booking the next time we come.

name: Angel
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
November 2021
,
Â·
Stayed with kids
review_text:
From the moment you walk into the breezeway, you will feel at peace. Staying away from home can sometimes be nerve wracking and cause some anxiety for myself, but this home was a home run out of the ballpark! The ease of contactless access and check-out was a blessing for us as some of our family had flight delays and others came early. It was so nice to see the little details throughout the homeâ€”like popcorn, travel sizes of shampoo and body wash, even some tide pods so we took home no dirty clothing. The linens throughout the home were wonderful, soft, and plentiful for our family or 8 guests and one baby. I cannot put into words what the shower feels like. It was like a spa experience and so talked of how wonderful it was. The water had our hair feeling so soft and it wasnâ€™t your average hotel shower that doesnâ€™t have any pressure to it. The checkout list was also helpful for the kids to see and know what was expected before leaving. The kids enjoyed watching movies and playing with toys in the upstairs 3rd bedroom/living room, which allowed the adults to enjoy some football without the kids being bored. This home had a fantastic table for all of us to enjoy meals together as we had family from several different states together. The home has a very warm feel and we would recommend to anyone looking to stay in the area or if you are just passing through! The price of a hotel was more for the area we were looking and Joyâ€™s home allowed for us to all be together, wash our clothing, and cook meals together for an even better price.
Thank you Joy for allowing our family to enjoy some very special moments together after such a hard time with the pandemic. We look forward to having more guests stay here in the future!

review_text: When I saw the photo, I just had to stay there! I love Victorian and historic homes and am tired of drab, soulless hotel rooms. The price was very reasonable for a room with a private bathroom and access to the kitchen, living room, and porch with chairs/table. Don communicated effectively and informed us of the code, how to check in, where to park, etc. Coffee, tea, and water were provided, and there was much room to store food in the refrigerator/freezer. The rooms were painted and decorated with professional care, and we enjoyed the two pieces of candy left on the bed tray. If you have time, you should take a self-guided tour of the historic homes nearby, too!

Stayed with kids
review_text: Beautiful vintage home! Quiet and peaceful. I was traveling with my sisters to visit our great aunt who was turning 95. She was in Piqua, Ohio. We chose this location for several reasons 1) it was only an hour away from Piqua. 2) the space was absolutely perfect for a large group. House was as pictured and described. 3) we love historic homes (the woodwork was so well preserved! The porch was inviting with plenty of room to relax). 4) the outdoor space had a lovely farmyard feel: oaks, fruit trees, huge barn, and well kept flowers/plants. We felt at home instantly. 5) very reasonable price! It was, by far, the perfect place for us. We enjoyed the ample sitting arrangement in both the living and dining rooms- we could just relax and chat, play games, and eat the meals prepared in the kitchen. I slept very well, the beds were so comfortable. Plenty of space for all of us! Bonnie was very attentive and made us feel welcomed to her beautiful home! I highly recommend Five Oaks!

name: Catherine
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
June 2022
,
Â·
Stayed with kids
review_text:
This is such a fantastic little b&b, and I can't say enough nice things about the host! My daughter forgot her iPad, and Kelly was so helpful in getting it back to us.
This place has more thoughtful amenities than you'll find at the most upscale hotel, at a price that compares to moderate/budget hotels. If you're staying in Decatur, it's really a no-brainer to stay here. It was really nice being able to give my daughter her own room during our stay, and having kitchen access while traveling is a must for us too. The snacks and cold waters we found upon our late night arrival were beyond appreciated after a day of travel, and having the spare basket of toiletries and night light available were nice perks. We also appreciated the soft towels/white linens, candles, and disposable plates/flatware for convenience. The muffins were delicious.
The location is easy to get to, and it was nice to have an off street parking spot. Located within a few minutes' drive of several restaurants, ice cream, etc.
Cleanliness was a 10/10, and I can't think of a single negative thing to say other than that the master bed was on the firm side, which some people might prefer. (the couch and twin beds are softer, so you've got options if you stay here.)
My daughter enjoyed the games and especially the coloring book provided, and said her bed felt cozy .
The decor was on point, and we enjoyed the bee theme in the kitchen and throughout the house. We could tell that a lot of effort was put into modern updates with a cohesive design.
Thank you for your attention to detail that made our stay next level. we hope to stay here the next time we're in Decatur!

review_text: This place is very cool. (I know that's an old term, but this loft is very well done). Modern design, with everything you need for a comfortable stay. Well appointed kitchen, large bathroom with walk-in shower, comfortable living space with a large tv. Great location right downtown so you can walk to a lot of places. The only caution I'd mention is the twenty-one steps to get up to the unit. As I said, we're old and decided to leave our large bags in the car rather than schlepping them up those steps. Also, the bed is a full, not a queen or a king. We were cozy, but just so you know. Otherwise, we thougholy enjoyed our stay.
